description: BroadcastReceiver.onReceive() takes longer than 10 seconds to execute, triggering ANR. System-level timeout for broadcast handling.
commonCauses: Synchronous network calls in broadcast handler
solutions: Use goAsync() for work exceeding 10 seconds
Launch JobIntentService instead of doing work directly
Keep onReceive() minimal - delegate to service
Move processing to WorkManager or JobScheduler
Never do network/database work in onReceive()
prevention: Always use goAsync() if work might exceed 1 second
Delegate all real work to WorkManager
examples: val pendingResult = goAsync(); scope.launch { doWork(); pendingResult.finish() }
override fun onReceive(ctx: Context, intent: Intent) { ctx.startService(Intent(ctx, MyService::class.java)) }
